conclusion: Identify the given information: Number of turns m = 100, Resistance of the coil r = 10 Ohm, Resistance of the resistor R = 90 Ohm, Magnetic flux through each turn of the coil as a function of time: Φ(t) = 2 × 10^-2 sin(ωt) Wb, Angular frequency ω can be determined from the period T.

Determine the angular frequency ω: From the graph, the period T of the sinusoidal variation in magnetic flux is T = 6.28 × 10^-2 s. The relationship between angular frequency ω and period T is ω = 2π/T. Plugging in the values: ω = 2π/6.28 × 10^-2 = 100 rad/s.
Express the magnetic flux Φ(t): Φ(t) = 2 × 10^-2 sin(100t) Wb.

Calculate the induced EMF: The induced EMF E in a coil is given by Faraday's law of induction: E = -N dΦ/dt. Here, N = 100. First, find the derivative of the magnetic flux with respect to time: dΦ/dt = d/dt (2 × 10^-2 sin(100t)) = 2 × 10^-2 · 100 cos(100t) = 2 Wb/s · cos(100t). Therefore, E = -100 · 2 cos(100t) = -200 cos(100t) V.
Determine the maximum value of the EMF: The maximum value of the cosine function cos(100t) is 1. Hence, the maximum EMF E_max is 200 V.
The maximum value of the electromotive force generated by the alternating current generator is 200 V.
